title: The Brave Girl and the Div

source_text.text:
﻿A div demands a village daughter as tribute. A brave girl volunteers to spare her sisters. She rides a donkey to the div’s lair and meets an old woman who quietly hands her a bar of soap, a comb, and a needle, telling her to save them for escape.

The girl serves the div supper and sings him to sleep. She pockets the gifts and the div’s key-ring and slips away with her donkey before dawn.

The div wakes and charges after her. She throws the soap, and the path becomes a slippery hill of foam; the div slides. She throws the comb, which grows into a thorn forest; he claws through. She throws the needle, and a wall of briars rises; the div’s hide is torn and he gives up.

The girl reaches home with the key-ring of treasure. Her family and neighbors celebrate her wit and courage; she keeps the donkey as her loyal helper.

thinking_process: Heroine rescues herself and her kin by fleeing a div and casting obstacle-objects; maps cleanly to ATU 313.

motif.obstacle_thrower: Heroine casts each object herself from donkey-back.

bias_reflection.cultural_reading: Centers a female rescuer; Iranian Luri variants highlight grit and self-rescue without princely aid.
bias_reflection.gender_norms: Heroine performs both helper and hero roles; donkey functions as neutral helper.
bias_reflection.hero_villain_mapping: Div embodies brute force; heroine represents communal protection.
ambiguous_motifs: Old woman as donor vs helper
Treasure key-ring as reward vs evidence of victory

qa.notes: Expanded summary; kept obstacle pattern explicit for ATU 313.

source_text_persian.text: دختری دلیر به جای خواهرانش به دیو داده می‌شود. پیرزنی به او صابون، شانه و سوزن می‌دهد تا در فرار بیندازد. دیو بیدار می‌شود و دختر از روی الاغ می‌گریزد؛ صابون سرسره، شانه خارستان و سوزن بوته‌ی تیغ می‌شود و دیو می‌ماند. دختر با کلیدها و الاغ به خانه برمی‌گردد و مردم شجاعتش را می‌ستایند.
